translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about Worshipping the Charcoal Burner
and at that time I was a brahmin.
I saw the world’s most senior, the best of men,

analyzed: disvāna vandim pādesu  loka āhuti paṭiggaha
translated: After seeing him, I worshipped at his feet,🔽the one who receives offerings of the world.
The Buddha knew that I was full of confidence,
After leaving the grove,🔽I remembered the best of the Buddhas.
I rejoiced in heaven for an eon.
For twenty-two eons,🔽I praised that place.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of my praise.
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā desakittako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā desakittakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Desakittaka recited these verses.
